item.title: Volt Current Resistance
item.description:
Volt, current and resistance

What is voltage, really?

Voltage is what creates the push that makes electrons move. Voltage is the difference between two different points is a cicuit. With only one point voltage means nothing. It’s measured in volt (V).

What is current, really?

Current is the rate of electrons. You can think of current as a result of the amount of voltage and resistance in a cicuit. Current can only flow when there is a continues path. It’s measured in ampere (A).
